The Mountains are Calling

Incredible singletrack, breathtaking views, and mile after mile of flowy perfection: The Alps are a true mountain bike mecca â€” and itâ€™s time you experienced them all. Hereâ€™s everything you need to make 2019 the year of your amazing transalp adventure.

 

The best transalp routes â€” handpicked for you

From beginner rides to advanced adventures, here are some of the most breathtaking transalps for you to ride this summer.

 
The Via Claudia Augusta: Your first transalp

Tours: 7 Distance: 517 km Elevation: 4130 m

The transalp of choice for the Romans, this beautiful ride takes you all the way from Augsburg to Lake Garda. With asphalted cycle ways making up much of the route, itâ€™s the perfect adventure for first-timers.

 

Alpe Adria: The World War 1 transalp

Tours: 5 Distance: 271 km Elevation: 5.690 m

Discover still-standing remnants of one of our greatest tragedies as you ride from Austria, through Slovenia â€” all the way to Italy.

 

Marvin Route: an advanced transalp

Tours: 7 Distance: 433 km Elevation: 11.860 m

Experience breathtaking views, stunning mountain passes and some truly rewarding climbs. And do so as early as spring.

The Heckmair Transalp

Tours: 7 Distance: 412 km Elevation: 14.040 m

Go back to where it all started on the Heckmair Transalp: The route that took the first mountain bikers across the Alps.

 

Transalp extreme - Garmisch to Garda

Tours: 7 Distance: 479 km Elevation: 12.690 m

From the most epic singletrack to the best views ever, this route delivers some amazing moments. You just have to earn them.

 

Go west on the Maximilian Way

Tours: 12 Distance: 652 km Elevation: 16.510 m

Experience what it means to truly cross the Alps on the Max Trail â€” a transalp from east to west over five stunning mountain ranges.

The Trans-Slovenia Alp crossing

Tours: 7 Distance: 439 km Elevation: 10.520 m

Experience lonely trails and tiny villages on this real adventure off the beaten track. Still relatively unknown to cyclists of all disciplines, if itâ€™s solitude youâ€™re after, sleepy Slovenia is for you.

The ride of your life from Zillertal to Lake Garda

Tours: 7 Distance: 370 km Elevation: 12.960 m

This route deviates from the classic trails â€” and thatâ€™s what makes it so special. On this transalp, youâ€™ll encounter it all, from smoothly asphalted sections to a hike-a-bike crashcourse in the mountains.

The weekend transalp

Tours: 4 Distance: 209 km Elevation: 8.530 m

Find out whether the challenge of a transalp is right for you on this 3-day adventure over peaks and passes from Austria to Switzerland and back.

 
—

Your personal packing list

While you ride:

Helmet, cycling shorts, jersey, rain jacket, socks, cycling shoes, buff.

In your backpack (25-30 l):

Spare clothes:
A spare jersey, spare cycling shorts, two pairs of underpants, two pairs of socks.

During the day:
Water bladder, sunscreen, first aid kit, headlamp, bike lock, energy bars and gels, cell phone, power bank, cash, credit card, passport.

During the night:
Sleeping bag liner, sandals/slippers, comfy pants, fleece, T-shirt, toothbrush and paste, charger for your devices.

Extras:
Multi-tool, pump, two spare tubes, patch kit, duct tape & zip ties, brake pads, chain lube, spare derailleur hanger, spare spokes, two shift/brake cables.

 
—
